page.title: 19FORESTRY AROUND LAMLASH.
page.content: The forestry in Lamlash occupies an area roughly 2.5Km square in the north west part of Lamlash.The land it occupies would otherwise be rough moorland,which is of very little use to the dairy farmers of Lamlash. The Coniferous trees were planted during a period from 1960_1962.At the present moment they are not yet fully mature.This means that the forestry will have to wait until at least 1995 before they will be ready for cutting and exporting to the mainland. It is only on the highest and most exposed areas that the forestry does not penetrate,due to the poor soils and high winds.There is always the threat of deer eating the younger trees and scraping the bark off the older trees,For this reason the deer population is kept to a minimum.
